translation: Good afternoon everyone!
transcript: 大家下午好！

translation: With the Internet technologies being highly developed.
transcript: 我们现在的互联网技术已经相当发达了。

translation: Today we can send conveniently a joke, a picture or a video through WeChat to a family member or a friend.
transcript: 通过微信我们可以很方便地给我们的亲朋好友发个笑话、发个图片、发个视频。

translation: 10 GB of data could even be sent out within only one minute.
transcript: 甚至就是我们用一分钟，发个十个G都可以。

translation: But there are also some things not so easy to be sent.
transcript: 但是也有东西很难发。

translation: Say, transferring ten US dollars to your friend in the US might prove very challenging for you.
transcript: 比如你给你，嗯美国的朋友发个十美金，你试一下，会很难。

translation: That's because assets like US dollars are irreproducible and their peer-to-peer transmission must be credit-based.
transcript: 这是因为像美金这样的资产，它是不可复制的，它的点对点传递需要信任。

translation: So how do we make credit work in our real life?
transcript: 那么这个信任我们在现实生活中是如何解决的呢？

translation: Most of the times we depend on intermediaries such as the government and banks.
transcript: 在实际的生活中，我们很多时候，是依赖于像政府、银行这样的中间机构。

translation: All those intermediaries constitute the basis of the social credit system.
transcript: 由这种各种各样的中间机构，它们构成了我们社会的信用的基础。

translation: Generally they are very good at their work.
transcript: 很多时候，它们都工作得很好。

translation: And that earns them the title "omnipotent intermediaries".
transcript: 所以我们称它们是万能的中介。

translation: But problems still exist.
transcript: 但是好像生活中也有很多问题。

translation: For example, cross-border remittance, as I just mentioned.
transcript: 比如刚才提到的，跨境汇款。

translation: Is always known for its low efficiency and high cost.
transcript: 它不但效率低，成本还很高。

translation: Another example is, suppose one day you buy a house and the next day you may wake up being sieged by crowds zealously ready to offer you help in redecorating it.
transcript: 今天我们买个房子，明天就有很多大哥大姐来关心你，房子怎么装修。

translation: Obviously your private information has been leaked.
transcript: 明显隐私泄露了。

translation: So those intermediaries can also turn out to be very unreliable.
transcript: 所以好多时候我们又说这些中介，是万恶的中介。

translation: Is there a possibility that we could use some technology to optimize and even reconstruct the basis of the social credit system?
transcript: 我们有没有可能，利用技术去优化，甚至于去重构这个社会的信任基础呢？

translation: In 2008, a hacker named Satoshi Nakamoto released a peer-to-peer electronic cash system.
transcript: 零八年一位叫中本聪的黑客，发布了一套点对点的电子支付系统。

translation: This system, after being launched on line,was cheered by hacker groups and all kinds of gray organizations such as those that run gambling and money laundering business.
transcript: 这套系统上线以后,先后受到了很多黑客组织以及博彩组织、洗钱组织等等各种灰色组织的青睐。

translation: "Bitcoin System", that's its name.
transcript: 这套系统就是比特币系统。

translation: The value of bitcoins has surged by a million times in the past eight years.
transcript: 比特币也在这个八年间上涨了上百万倍。

translation: That may suggest a high possibility of speculation.
transcript: 这里当然有很大的投机成分在里头了。

translation: But it's hard to deny that bitcoins indeed have some essential value.
transcript: 但是不可否认的是，比特币它有它的核心价值。

translation: Let's look closely and see how the bitcoin transactions are different from traditional money transfer services conducted by banks.
transcript: 我们不妨一起来看一下，比特币转账跟银行转账，它有什么不一样？

translation: The left side of the screen shows us how the banks perform money transfers, which we are very familiar with.
transcript: 这左边的那个银行转账我们大家都很熟悉了。

translation: Banks work as a reliable intermediary to make credit work at its best.
transcript: 它是依赖于银行这个中间机构来加持信用。

translation: The entire process, in which banks, like a bookkeeper.
transcript: 同时是依赖于银行来帮它记账。

translation: Deduct some money from the account A and add the money to the account B, is quite simple.
transcript: 就是在A账户减一下，在B账户加一下，它比较简单。

translation: The right side of the screen displays how the bitcoin transfers work.
transcript: 右边的这个比特币转账。

translation: It's more complicated, and I'll explain it a little bit.
transcript: 看起来比较复杂，我给大家简单介绍一下。

translation: When A is transferring bitcoins to B.
transcript: 当A向B做一个比特币转账的时候。

translation: Information of this transaction will be sent to all the nodes of the bitcoin network through the P2P technology.
transcript: 这笔交易比特币系统，它是利用P2P的网络技术，传送到所有的比特币网络节点。

translation: Then all the nodes will use a consensus algorithm to check the validity of the transaction.
transcript: 所有的网络节点再采用共同的算法，一起去验证这笔交易它是不是有效的。

translation: The result of each node's check will then be sent through the P2P technology to all the other nodes.
transcript: 同时再把这个验证结果，再通过P2P网络技术传送给所有的其他节点。

translation: The nodes will jointly analyze the results of the check, authenticate and record the transaction.
transcript: 然后大家再根据这个验证的结果，一起来记账。

translation: The entire process depends on algorithms to achieve a consensus and thus builds its own credit system.
transcript: 它是以通过算法来达成共识，产生信用。

translation: It works like an online ledger.
transcript: 然后它是依赖于网络来记账。

translation: Involving all the nodes of the network at the same time.
transcript: 让网络上的每一个节点来共同记账。

translation: And what's most important.
transcript: 最大的不一样。

translation: You may find that intermediaries are no longer needed here.
transcript: 你会发现这里面是不再需要中间机构了。

translation: That's also why financial institutions in recent two years are swarming to study this technology that might be a game changer in future.
transcript: 这也是为什么这两年，有很多金融机构，它们会去研究这个技术的原因，因为这个技术有可能带来一个颠覆性的一个效应。

translation: This technology is the blockchain.
transcript: 这个技术就是我们讲的区块链技术。

translation: It is in general composed of five technologies.
transcript: 它主要包含有五大类的技术。

translation: P2P technologies, consensus algorithms, blockchain construction, smart contracts and cryptography.
transcript: 刚才提到的P2P网络技术，还有共识算法技术以及块链结构技术，还有智能合约、密码学。

translation: Those five technologies are not newly invented and they have actually existed for many years.
transcript: 这五个技术，其实它不是，它都不是什么新的技术，实际上它很多年前就存在了。

translation: But combined together, they burst into a magical chemical reaction and create a new-type credit system.
transcript: 但是它们组合在一起，就形成了一种神奇的化学反应，它能够创造信任。

translation: It's just like ten years ago, when Steve Jobs compounded the cell phone, the iPod and the browser technology, iPhone came out.
transcript: 这就好比在十年前的乔布斯，将手机加上ipod再加上浏览器，就创造了神奇的iPhone一样。

translation: As a provider of the third-party payment system for years.
transcript: 我们在这么多年做第三方支付系统的过程中。

translation: We have combined our decades of expertise with the blockchain ideologies and the peculiarities of many businesses we've met in practice, and independently invented a new blockchain system.
transcript: 我们将十几年的技术积累，结合区块链的技术理念以及我们现实中很多企业机构的信息系统的特点，重新自主创新了一套新的区块链系统。

translation: Which is based on database and named TrustSQL.
transcript: 一种基于数据库的区块链系统，我们叫它TrustSQL。

translation: As we see it, blockchain should be considered as a very basic technology for connection.
transcript: 我们认为像区块链这种技术，它是属于那个基础底层的那个基础连接技术。

translation: As a reliable technology, it could be used to tackle the problems with the intermediaries I mentioned earlier.
transcript: 我们前面提到很多中介的问题，如果我们结合区块链的这个技术技可信的技术能力。

translation: Based on it, very specific, practical measures and applications can be proposed and implemented.
transcript: 以具体的针对具体的问题，制定出实际的应用解决方案。

translation: They could then be optimized and even be used to enhance mutual trust between institutions or businesses.
transcript: 然后我们运用这些基础的应用方案去优化，甚至是解决我们机构，甚至企业之间互信的问题。

translation: In this way, the collaboration between different organizations will be more trustworthy, more efficient and less expensive.
transcript: 那么就会使得我们机构之间的协作变得更加地可信，效率更高，成本更低。

translation: And thus the largest possible value might be created.
transcript: 从而实现真正的价值最大化。

translation: So how exactly does the technology work?
transcript: 那我我们具体如何去使用这种技术呢？

translation: Many people will associate the blockchain with the bitcoin, and some even define the blockchine as a tool in finance.
transcript: 之前我们提到区块链，很多人就想到比特币，甚至有人觉得是金融。

translation: But let's try something different today.
transcript: 今天我们聊一点不一样的东西。

translation: Suppose someone in your family goes missing.
transcript: 比如我们的亲人走丢了。

translation: Can you think of a faster way to find him or her?
transcript: 我们能不能把他找到更快一点？

translation: We all hear of some philanthropic organizations who can help look for the missing people.
transcript: 我们都知道现在就有很多公益寻人机构。

translation: But because they usually ask for registration and authentication, controversies rage over the security of the registration information, the ownership of the data and the protection of privacy.
transcript: 但是我们并不知道这些机构因为信息验证录入，信息那个数据安全的问题，以及数据归属的问题，还有那个隐私保护的问题等等这种各样的问题。

translation: Which leads to a wavering mutual trust between all those organizations.
transcript: 造成这些机构之间，其实它们并不是那么互信的。

translation: In that manner, each organization is actually made into a highly isolated island of information.
transcript: 也就使得它们这一个个的机构，其实是一个高度孤立的信息孤岛。

translation: What's the problem with that?
transcript: 这有什么问题呢？

translation: I'll give you an example.
transcript: 举个例子。

translation: If a child gets lost.
transcript: 当我们的小孩走丢了。

translation: It usually requires an interval of several hours between inputting information at the first node and then doing that at the second node.
transcript: 从第一个节点录入信息的时候，到第二个节点去录入信息，这里通常需要好几个小时。

translation: During the interval.
transcript: 在这个过程中呢。

translation: Perhaps the missing child may happen to come within the reach of the loudspeaker of the second node.
transcript: 很可能这个小孩正在走过第二个节点的广播区域。

translation: Or this child might have already been found and taken home for dinner.
transcript: 也很可能你已经找到了，都回家吃饭了。

translation: But those organizations who are looking for the child don't know this.
transcript: 但是各个机构其实它并不知道这个信息。

translation: They keep searching and thus cause a huge waste of resources.
transcript: 它还在到处找人，造成大量的资源浪费。

translation: This year in April.
transcript: 今年4月份。

translation: Together with "Baobeihuijia" and the "404 Not-Found project".
transcript: 我们以“宝贝回家”，还有“404寻人”。

translation: We used our TrustSQL sharing-ledger solution and constructed a philanthropic finding-the-missing-people chain.
transcript: 利用TrustSQL的共享账本解决方案，一起打造了一个公益寻人链。

translation: Any information input at one node could be shared throughout the entire chain.
transcript: 它可以做到一点录入，全链通用。

translation: Thus problems like the "isolated islands" could be avoided.
transcript: 能够有效地去孤规避这信息孤岛的问题。

translation: And the work of looking for missing people could be more efficient and transparent.
transcript: 使得寻人变得更加地高效，变得更加地高效、透明。

translation: Take something that happened around me.
transcript: 呃有一件事正好是发生在我身边的。

translation: Half a month ago.
transcript: 在半个月以前。

translation: A high-school classmate of mine.
transcript: 我的一个高中同学。

translation: Terribly uneasy, came to me and told me his father, who was very old, went lost.
transcript: 很着急地找到我，说他们家的老人走丢了。

translation: I remember it was the afternoon of August 14th.
transcript: 那天我还记得是八月十四号的下午。

translation: We immediately got him registered and authenticated that very night.
transcript: 当晚我们就一起帮助他，完成了信息的校验与录入。

translation: And the next day, at noon.
transcript: 第二天中午。

translation: Good news came through his happy tone.
transcript: 我的同学他就非常高兴地告诉我。

translation: His father was back—even much faster than he had imagined.
transcript: 他们家老人找回来了，而且他是没想到还可以这么快就能够找回来。

translation: Neither had we thought he could be found within such a short period.
transcript: 当时其实我们也没有想到可以这么快就可以找回来。

translation: Later when we were investigating the whole thing.
transcript: 我们去核实的时候。

translation: We found that it was the "Moments" of WeChat that circulated the information of the missing old man that helped us find him.
transcript: 发现这个老人是通过微信的朋友圈广告找回来的。

translation: That's to say, when we were registering on "Baobeihuijia" website that night.
transcript: 也就是说当晚我们完成信息录入的时候，从“宝贝回家”录入。

translation: The node at WeChat immediately captured the information about my classmate's missing father, sent it out and spread it by means of its "Moments".
transcript: 然后从微信那个寻人节点上，立马就获取到这个信息，同时利用微信的朋友圈广告，广播出去了。

translation: Luckily, the old man was recognized by someone who had seen the information.
transcript: 让有缘人看到了这个广告，发现了这位老人。

translation: That's why we could find him so quickly.
transcript: 所以我们在很快速的时间里，把这个老人找回来了。

translation: Small as the case might sound, the charm of the blockchain was profoundly felt and revealed here.
transcript: 虽然这是一个小小的寻人的一个案例，但是我们也深深发现，这里面体现出了区块链技术的魅力。

translation: It can make our society more heartwarming.
transcript: 它其实可以让我们的社会的价值变得，可以让我们的社会变得更加的温暖。

translation: That is a small case.
transcript: 这是一个小的案例。

translation: Now let's see something bigger.
transcript: 其实我们可以想一些大一点的。

translation: Once a notorious question was posed, which went, "How can you prove that the woman you call "mom" is your real mother?"
transcript: 有一个非常出名的社会话题，就是怎么做好证明你妈是你妈。

translation: It caused a huge uproar.
transcript: 就是说它其实挺轰动的。

translation: When we were developing our blockchain technology, a thought constantly occurred to us that actually in our whole life, from our birth to our old age.
transcript: 当时就是说我们做区块链的时候就想到，其实从我们出生到我们老去。

translation: We are also always urged to prove our identity—our existence, growth and capabilities.
transcript: 我们一直都在面对这个问题，我们在证明我们的存在、证明我们的成长、证明我们的能力。

translation: Why am I saying that?
transcript: 为什么呢？

translation: Because we are applying for certificates all the time, such as the student ID cards, birth certificates and property ownership certificates.
transcript: 因为我们一直在办证啊，办那个学生证，办出生证，然后办房产证。

translation: Those certificates cost us huge amounts of time and money, and bring us many troubles.
transcript: 同时在这个办证的过程中，我们还发现我们付出了很多的时间，付出了很多的那个金钱，还有遇到很多的麻烦。

translation: If the authentication applications of the blockchain could be used, then we would be able to combine all those information behind the certificates in a digital identity chain, and get an all-purpose certificate once and for all.
transcript: 假如我们可以利用区块链鉴证，鉴证证明的应用方案，可以将办证背后这些数据装在一个数字身份链上，做到真正的百证合一。

translation: Perhaps we'll just need to register our fingerprints and then be authenticated to exploit related data to prove our own identity.
transcript: 后以后我们只要一个指纹，就可以把这个数据授权调度出来，做好我们自己的个人证明。

translation: In that sense, I guess the "proving the identity of your mother" conundrum might finally vanish.
transcript: 是不是未来的社会，它就不会再出现，怎么证明你妈是你妈这样的一个问题呢？

translation: In that sense, I guess the "proving the identity of your mother" conundrum might finally vanish.
transcript: 另外，大家不知有没有去想过，我们未来的社会，真没有现金了，它会怎么样？

translation: Earlier this year there was a very popular TV drama named "In the Name of People".
transcript: 上半年有一部电视剧非常地火爆，叫《人民的名义》。

translation: It began with an official surnamed Zhao being caught grafting 100 million RMB.
transcript: 里面有一位赵处长，一开场的时候就被抓了，贪了一个亿。

translation: When I was watching this.
transcript: 当时我看到这里的时候。

translation: I couldn't help thinking that.
transcript: 我就在想。

translation: If in future all the assets like cash could be digitized and placed in the blockchain.
transcript: 如果我们未来的社会可以把现金等各种各样的资产，它可以数字化了，它可以放到区块链里头，

translation: Whose data are unalterable but trackable, then perhaps the anti-corruption conundrum haunting Chinese history for thousands of years would finally be effectively solved.
transcript: 利用区块链它不可篡改，可以追踪的能力，我们千年的反腐难题，是不是也能够得到有效的控制呢？

translation: To sum up, we have used several cases today to focus on three benefits the blockchain will bring to us.
transcript: 刚才我们讲了几个案例，就是说有三个点子。

translation: And we will find that the blockchain is offering another possibility to our world in future.
transcript: 我们会发现因为区块链，我们的未来世界，有了另外一种可能。

translation: That is well demonstrated by the fact that the block chain can optimize the basis of our social credit system.
transcript: 就像去运用这区块链这种技术，去优化我们社会的信用基础。

translation: We used to build houses with wood and stones.
transcript: 也就好比我们以前建房子用的是木头跟石头。

translation: But now we have shifted to steel and concrete.
transcript: 我们现在建房子，用的是钢筋、混凝土。

translation: The blockchain is just like steel and concrete in the online world.
transcript: 也许这区块链技术就是我们要找的钢筋混凝土。

translation: It will build a more harmonious and solid bond between people, organizations and even countries, thereby making their cooperation more efficient and transparent, and helping them create more value for the society.
transcript: 它可以使得我们未来的人与人之间，机构与机构之间，甚至国家与国家之间的关系变得更加地融洽、牢固，使得我它们之间的协作变得更加地高效、透明，为社会创造更大的价值。

translation: As long as we can break through our mental barriers, dare to try, and harbor integrity and love in our heart.
transcript: 只要我们敢于去突破我们的思维，勇于去尝试，我们心中有一颗正直温暖的心。

translation: We'll be able to make the blockchain shine like a bright star.
transcript: 那我们也可以让这个技术，散发出耀眼的光芒。

translation: Thank you.
transcript: 谢谢大家。
